item.title: 英国同意就其奴隶制遗产与英联邦举行会谈
item.description: 在萨摩亚与其他英联邦国家领导人发表的联合声明中，英国同意就其历史上参与贩卖奴隶的问题举行会谈，但继续排除了进行经济赔偿的可能性。【原文：The UK agreed to hold talks about its historical involvement in the slave trade in a joint statement with other Commonwealth leaders’ in Samoa, but continued to rule out the prospect of financial reparations.】

item.title: 暴风雨 "特拉米 "临近，越南四个机场停飞
item.description: 热带风暴 "特拉米 "已给菲律宾带来死亡和破坏，越南当局正准备暂停中部省份四个机场的运营。【原文：Vietnamese authorities are preparing to suspend operations at four airports in its central provinces as the country braces for Tropical Storm Trami, which already brought death and destruction to the Philippines.】

item.title: 曼谷邮报》报道：泰国将把退休年龄提高到 65 岁
item.description: 据《曼谷邮报》报道，由于医疗保健和医疗技术的进步，泰国计划将私营部门和政府部门的退休年龄提高到 65 岁。【原文：Thailand plans to lift the retirement age for both the private and government sectors to 65, due to improvements in healthcare and medical technology, the Bangkok Post reported.】

item.title: 特朗普的关税升级计划为何遭到如此多的仇视？
item.description: 美国在其历史上的大部分时期都对进口产品征收重税，从 20 世纪 30 年代开始，随着政府领导人接受自由贸易的理念，美国基本上放弃了这一政策。高额关税在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）担任总统期间卷土重来，他采用高额关税的目的是为了振兴美国制造业，并对抗美国认为是中国的不公平贸易行为。特朗普的继任者乔-拜登保持了这一趋势。【原文：The US heavily taxed imports for much of its history before largely abandoning the policy, beginning in the 1930s, as government leaders embraced the idea of free trade. High tariffs made a comeback during the presidency of Donald Trump, who adopted them in an effort to revitalize American manufacturing and to counter what the US regards as China’s unfair trade practices. Trump’s successor Joe Biden kept the trend going.】

item.title: 台积电创始人称自由贸易失效，台积电面临严峻挑战
item.description: 台湾积体电路制造股份有限公司（Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co.【原文：Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co.’s founder Morris Chang said the the company will soon face its “most severe” challenges in driving growth at a time that the US is controlling the flows of cutting-edge chips to China.】

item.title: 随着马克龙计划的失败，他找到了一位真正的财政部长人选
item.description:
法国有史以来最年轻的财政部长肩负着在政治不确定性中控制国家公共财政失控的重任。【原文：

France’s youngest-ever finance minister is tasked with reining in the country’s runaway public finances amid political uncertainty.

】

item.title: 中国九个月处罚贪污58.9万人
item.description: 今年前九个月，中国反渎职侵权机构处罚了 58.9 万名违纪人员，其中包括受贿或行贿。【原文：China’s anti-graft agency punished 589,000 people in first nine months of the year for discipline violations, including accepting or offering bribery.】

item.title: 高官称中国刺激经济旨在促进消费
item.description: 中国财政部副部长廖岷表示，中国最近推出的经济刺激措施主要是为了拉动内需和实现国家的年度经济增长目标。【原文：China’s recent rollout of stimulus is centered around lifting domestic demand and hitting the nation’s annual growth goal, said Vice Finance Minister Liao Min, as investors await a meeting of lawmakers expected to unveil details of Beijing’s crucial fiscal package.】

item.title: 达美航空就 "灾难性 "软件故障起诉 CrowdStrike 公司
item.description: 达美航空公司（Delta Air Lines Inc）起诉网络安全公司 CrowdStrike Holdings Inc.【原文：Delta Air Lines Inc. sued cybersecurity firm CrowdStrike Holdings Inc. over the chaos caused this summer by a “catastrophic” software update that disabled millions of computers worldwide and grounded much of the airline’s passenger fleet.】

item.title: 摩洛哥力争在 2026 年放松与欧元-美元的货币挂钩
item.description: 摩洛哥央行行长在接受采访时说，摩洛哥的目标是在 2026 年放松本国的汇率制度，回到在大流行病期间停止的渐进式改革进程。【原文：Morocco aims to loosen the kingdom’s exchange rate regime in 2026, returning to a gradual reform process that was halted during the pandemic, the central bank governor said in an interview.】

item.title: 对中国股市而言，刺激政策比美国大选更重要
item.description: 对多年来中美贸易争端习以为常的投资者似乎愿意冒着美国总统大选后关税进一步提高的风险，并在更多刺激措施的押注下青睐中国资产。【原文：Investors inured to years of Sino-American trade spat seem willing to brave the risk of even higher tariffs following the US presidential election, and are favoring Chinese assets on bets for more stimulus.】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会称，马斯克为缺席会议支付 2,923 美元的提议不够充分
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会（US Securities Exchange Commission）表示，埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）提出支付 2,923 美元还不够，因为在上个月对其 2022 年收购推特公司（Twitter Inc.【原文：The US Securities Exchange Commission says Elon Musk’s offer to pay $2,923 isn’t enough for standing up three agency lawyers who were set to question him last month in an investigation of his 2022 purchase of Twitter Inc.】

item.title: 加密货币 "大到不能倒 "的代币 Tether 面临来自美国的新威胁
item.description: 在过去一年中，美国监管机构和检察官对加密货币公司采取的所有法律行动中，可以说没有哪一个会像对 Tether 控股有限公司（Tether Holdings Ltd. ）的潜在打击那样，对数字资产行业造成如此大的震荡。【原文：Of all the legal actions taken against cryptocurrency companies by US regulators and prosecutors over the past year, arguably none threatens to shake up the digital-asset industry as much as a potential crackdown on Tether Holdings Ltd.】

item.title: 国家监察机构警告：中国正在扫描加拿大的网络防御系统
item.description: 加拿大政府周五警告说，"一个来自中华人民共和国的复杂的国家支持的威胁行为者 "一直在扫描重要公共实体的网络防御系统。【原文：The Canadian government warned Friday that “a sophisticated state-sponsored threat actor from the People’s Republic of China” has been scanning the cyber defenses of important public entities.】

item.title: 监管机构指责 Keystone 运营商造成泄漏
item.description: 根据美国监管机构的一份报告，Keystone 输油管道的运营商对 2022 年导致近 13,000 桶原油从管道泄漏的故障负有部分责任。【原文：The operator of the Keystone pipeline is partly to blame for failures that contributed to the spilling of nearly 13,000 barrels of crude from the line in 2022, according to a report by US regulators.】

item.title: 法院裁定埃隆-马斯克关于特斯拉工会的推文并非威胁
item.description: 联邦上诉法院裁定，埃隆-马斯克在 2018 年发布推文称，如果特斯拉公司员工成立工会，他们将失去股票期权，他并没有非法威胁特斯拉公司员工，这让这位亿万富翁在因其在社交媒体上的言论而引发的众多法律纠纷中赢得了一场胜利。【原文：A federal appeals court ruled Elon Musk didn’t illegally threaten Tesla Inc. workers when he tweeted in 2018 that they would lose stock options if they unionized, handing the billionaire a win in one of the many legal fights over his comments on social media.】

item.title: 印度央行行长回击削减食品通胀目标的呼吁
item.description: 印度央行行长沙克提坎塔-达斯（Shaktikanta Das）拒绝了一位政府高级顾问提出的将波动较大的食品价格从通胀目标中剔除的建议，称此举对普通消费者毫无意义。【原文：India’s central bank Governor Shaktikanta Das rejected the proposal of a top government adviser to strip volatile food prices from inflation targets, saying such a move would make no sense to normal consumers.】

item.title: 布鲁克菲尔德集团寻求出售 15 亿美元私人信贷
item.description: 据知情人士透露，布鲁克菲尔德财富管理公司（Brookfield Wealth Solutions）正寻求从其于 2022 年收购的保险公司 American National 的资产负债表中剥离价值约 15 亿美元的私人信贷组合。【原文：Brookfield Wealth Solutions is looking to offload a private credit portfolio worth around $1.5 billion from the balance sheet of American National, an insurance company it acquired in 2022, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 穆迪因赤字问题将法国评级展望降至负面
item.description: 穆迪评级公司在两周内第三次对法国的信用评级发出负面展望警告，原因是法国公共财政状况恶化，在控制预算赤字膨胀方面面临政治挑战。【原文：France’s credit rating was put on a negative outlook by Moody’s Ratings in the third warning in the space of two weeks over the deterioration of public finances and the political challenges in containing containing swollen budget deficits.】

item.title: 对冲基金和资产经理因大选风险转而看多美元
item.description: 投机性货币交易商两个月来首次押注美元走强。这一转变发生在距离美国大选还有两周的时候。【原文：Speculative currency traders are betting on a stronger greenback for the first time in two months. The shift comes two weeks out from the US election.】

item.title: 收益率快速攀升，华尔街多头本周无忧收官
item.description: 这一周，通胀担忧重现、债券收益率飙升、美国总统政治沸沸扬扬，但对风险资产多头来说，最大的收获可能是这些事情最终对他们的影响微乎其微。【原文：After a week when inflation fears revived, bond yields jumped and US presidential politics stewed, the biggest takeaway for risk-asset bulls may be how little any of it ended up bothering them.】

item.title: 亚马逊高级食品杂货主管托尼-霍格特离职
item.description: 过去两年领导亚马逊公司杂货业务的高管托尼-霍格特（Tony Hoggett）即将离开这家电子商务巨头。【原文：Tony Hoggett, the executive who led Amazon.com Inc.’s grocery business for the last two years, is leaving the e-commerce giant.】

item.title: 金融稳定委员会将下任主席竞选推迟至六月
item.description: 世界最高金融稳定监管机构已将主席克拉斯-克诺（Klaas Knot）的任期延长至 6 月底，从而推迟了任命继任者以应对全球金融领域最棘手工作之一的竞争。【原文：The world’s top financial stability watchdog has extended the term of chair Klaas Knot until the end of June, postponing the race to appoint a successor to tackle one of the toughest jobs in global finance.】

item.title: 萨利纳斯旗舰部门出售 3.5 亿美元汇款债券
item.description: 墨西哥亿万富翁里卡多-萨利纳斯（Ricardo Salinas）的埃莱克特拉集团（Grupo Elektra）的零售部门在全球市场上融资 3.5 亿美元，用于偿还面临评级下调风险的现有票据，因为评级下调将触发提前还款。【原文：The retail arm of Mexican billionaire Ricardo Salinas’ Grupo Elektra tapped global markets for $350 million to pay back existing notes that faced the risk of a rating downgrade that would trigger early repayments.】

item.title: Integral Ad Science 探索潜在的出售机会
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Integral Ad Science Holding Corp. 在收到收购意向后，正在探索潜在的出售方案。【原文：Integral Ad Science Holding Corp. is exploring a potential sale after receiving takeover interest, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 加密货币在美国调查 Tether 的报道后下跌
item.description: 据报道，美国正在调查支撑数字资产交易的 Tether 稳定币的发行商，随后加密货币全线下跌。【原文：Cryptocurrencies dipped across the board following a report that the US was investigating the issuer of the Tether stablecoin that underpins much of the trading in the digital asset world.】

item.title: 马克莱姆认为移民改革对通胀影响不大
item.description: 加拿大央行行长蒂夫-马克莱姆（Tiff Macklem）表示，虽然联邦政府削减移民目标的决定会对经济增长产生一定影响，但对通胀的影响可能有限。【原文：Bank of Canada Governor Tiff Macklem said that while the federal government’s decision to trim immigration targets would have a modest impact on growth, the impact on inflation is likely limited.】

item.title: 市政银行家摆脱花旗退出，庆祝交易大丰收
item.description: 本周在旧金山，市政债券银行家们并没有为行业担忧或巨头花旗集团今年早些时候的离职而焦虑不安。【原文：In San Francisco this week, municipal-bond bankers weren’t fretting about industry concerns or the departure of giant Citigroup Inc. earlier this year.】

item.title: 真蒂洛尼说，不要把欧盟对中国电动汽车征收关税说成是保护主义
item.description: 欧盟最高经济官员表示，欧盟对中国制造的电动汽车征收关税的设想不能被视为保护主义。【原文：The European Union’s top economic official said that envisioned tariffs by the bloc on Chinese-made electric vehicles can’t be considered protectionism.】

item.title: Nexus 为收购 Big Lots 获得 7.65 亿美元融资
item.description: 在私募股权公司 Nexus Capital Management 获得 7.65 亿美元的承诺融资，以支持其收购破产的折扣零售商 Big Lots Inc.【原文：A federal judge approved Nexus Capital Management as the lead bidder to acquire Big Lots Inc. after the private equity firm obtained $765 million in committed financing to support its proposed acquisition of the discount retailer out of bankruptcy.】
